column4: okay -- I've got 1.5GB of memory in this box -- cat /proc/meminfo says that only ~40MB is free, top only has 4 processes using >0% memory (10 + 5 + 5 + 2)% which is no where near ~1.1GB of ram -- so where is all my memory going to?
run "free -m", and the second line with numbers is the values you actually care about
were those numbers from the first or second line with numbers?
1.3GB of ram to run a recently opened firefox - 4 terminals, calc and pidgin?
you don't care about that line
it's the second line with numbers you actually care about
-/+ buffers/cache runs into where the total might be
the rest is being used to cache stuff from your hard drive, and other things like that
it feels like the first line -- 1516/1390/125 total/used/freer
it will be released if anything actually needs the memory
